title: Corporate Typeface Pair
content:
Greeting All Typophiles.

My first post, but I had been lurking here for a long time.

Briefly saying, I'm working on a educational corporate brochure with the target audience being middle and higher management. However, it can't look too sophisticated - good value for your buck kind of feel.

I need help finding a display and body face.

For the display, I like:  
Serifa  
Interstate  
Foundry Form  
Ceacilia  
Rockwell

and text:  
Bodoni  
Myriad  
TheSans

What do you think? Serifa with Myriad and The Sans? What about Bodoni?

Pav
author: TrueMrP

comments.content: If you choose from these faces, i’d try Caecilia for body text and Foundry Form for display. Bodoni only if you work with a good Bodoni for text sizes (like ITC Bodoni 12).

If your text isn't too long, Caecilia's x-height might not be too large.

hhp
A slabserif is always the worst possible choice for body text! I love Caecilia's curves in bigger sizes, for text I would choose a sans serif above Bodoni, as small as possible.

A wedge-serif on the other hand strikes a very nice middle ground between slabs and full adnates.

hhp

<cite>"A slabserif is always the worst possible choice for body text!"</cite>

Yes, even compared to Curlz MT! :-\  
Seriously – that is a dubitable statement if I've ever seen one. There are some slabs that read quite nicely (if maybe not for entire books). Caecilia is a pretty nice one (although its x-height really is a bit large).
I like Caecilia as a display. I need a sans serif for body text (content may go on the web as well)
